data.name: Disabled Merke
data.description: Disabled Merke is brewed on Swedish malt and fresh Northern Sweden water. Its powerful taste and balanced bitterness is indicative of a perfect balance of hops and malt. The beer is fermented in open jäskar where it gets plenty of time to mature.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Dark Lager
style.description: This beer's malt aroma and flavor are low but notable. Its color ranges from a very deep copper to a deep, dark brown. It has a clean, light body with discreet contributions from caramel and roasted malts. Non-malt adjuncts are often used, and hop rates are low. Hop bitterness is clean and has a short duration of impact. Hop flavor, and aroma are low. Carbonation is high. Fruity esters, diacetyl, and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Zeunerts
breweries.description:
About Zeunerts Craft Beer

BAVARIAN BEER CULTURE AND NORTHERN SWEDISH CHARACTERISTICS

This is precisely what Zeunerts is. A combination that guarantees high quality. It is quality that is the basis of Zeunerts’ business. The Bavarian art of brewing is without a doubt the finest in the world. As early as 1859, Christoffer August Zeunert introduced copper vats and open fermenting tubs in production and the tradition of ageing the beer to the perfect maturity and flavour. It goes without saying that we follow the German Beer Purity Laws.

 ONLY FIRST-CLASS RAW MATERIALS WILL DO HERE

We are extremely careful about raw materials. The water, the most important prerequisite for a good beer, gives us a strong advantage in quality. The fresh water of the Swedish North is the best water from which to make beer. At least that was the opinion of Christoffer August Zeunert. Hops are the spice of beer. The little hop cones contain the hundreds of flavours that give beer its bitterness, flavour and aroma. All hop varieties are carefully selected to suit their particular type of brew.

data.name: Dortmunder Export
data.description: Dortmunder style lager that is very easy drinking and effervescent, very food friendly, with subtle fruit notes from yeast.
data.foodPairings: Soft, mild cheeses, salads, seafood, pork, spicy ethnic fare and a good ol' pepperoni pizza.

breweries.name: Living The Dream Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
We are a dog friendly brewery & taproom located in Highlands Ranch, Colorado. 

Multiple beers brewed year long to quench your thirst during any activity. From a vigorous game of badminton to an afternoon of rev-ing your 2-stroke noise maker at a Nascar race, we've got ya covered.

data.name: Double Black
data.description: Cloaked in mystery and darkness, this style was originally stored in deep caves in the shadowy forests of Eastern Germany. Our dark, rich, roasty brew is full-bodied with subtle notes of caramel and chocolate sweetness and an unexpected fresh and crisp finish. Dark in color but smooth in flavor, this beer shows that looks can be deceiving.

style.name: American-Style Dark Lager

Hop bitterness is clean and has a short duration of impact. Hop flavor, and aroma are low. Carbonation is high. Fruity esters, diacetyl, and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Boston Beer Company
breweries.description:
Today, we're a team of about 750 people, and we all share a common passion for bringing great Samuel Adams beers to beer lovers everywhere. We've worked hard and are incredibly proud of the many successes we've enjoyed over the years. The Boston Beer Company has been cited as one of the best companies to work for by Boston Magazine, one of the Best Entry-Level Jobs by The Princeton Review, and our beers have won more awards than any other in history. Jim has been named an "Entrepreneur of the Year" by Inc. Magazine. Our brewers keep amazing us with innovative new brews, including Samuel Adams Utopias and our Samuel Adams Barrel Room Collection.

Jim has believed from the beginning that the more you know and understand about beer, the more you'll appreciate a beer like Samuel Adams Boston Lager. To begin that mission, all new employees go through intensive training on everything from ingredients, brewing, and beer styles, to taking care of the beer once it leaves the brewery. We're all beer lovers and protectors of the beer so we're trained how to identify off flavors and how to troubleshoot the causes. The passion for beer continues with an annual homebrew competition that we all take part in.

One of our wholesalers once asked Jim why he invested so much in training his people, when ultimately they might leave. Jim smiled and replied without hesitation: "What if I didn't train them, and they stayed?"

Each year, usually in January, everyone gathers together. One of the highlights of the meeting is the beer trivia contest. With a culture so steeped in beer education and knowledge, winning is a pretty big deal. Recently, one of the hotel bartenders who was watching as the various teams arrived in costume with music and much enthusiasm and fanfare, said, "I've always known Samuel Adams made the best beer in America, but now I see this is the greatest company in America." When you look around you see that The Boston Beer Company is a team of enthusiastic people who are passionate about beer and who really love coming to work every day to provide American drinkers with the best beer possible.

The Boston Beer Company, Inc. is a publicly-traded company listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol, SAM.

data.name: Durango Dark Lager
data.description: An American-Style Dark Lager brewed with Crystal and Chocolate malts. This beer’s deep mahogany color, medium body, and mild hopping result in a smooth light bodied, easy drinking dark beer.

breweries.name: Durango Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Durango Brewing Company is the third oldest microbrewery in Colorado. Brewing since 1990, our heritage dates to 1886 when Durango Beer and Ice Company became Durango Brewing Company. Our beers are hand crafted using the finest barley, hops, and yeast along with water born high in the San Juan Mountains of Southwest Colorado.

Presently our beers include Durango Amber Ale, Durango Dark Lager, Durango Wheat Beer, and Durango Golden Ale. We also brew Derail Ale, 2007 and 2008 Gold Medal Winner at the Great American Beer Festival (Other Strong Beer Category), and various seasonal beers. Seasonal selections include Blueberry Wheat, Durango Pale Ale, Durango Winter Ale, and 2009 GABF Gold Medal Winner - Colorfest, our fall seasonal.

In November 2007, we added our new Tap Room which has features inspired by the Narrow Gauge Railroad and the history of our town. The Tap Room is open seven days a week for all to relax and enjoy the Flavor of Durango. Stop by and try a sample or enjoy a fresh pint of any of our award winning beers. Our unique growlers are always available for carry out along with all our packaged products.

style.name: American-Style Dark Lager

breweries.name: Tap Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Formerly 2 separate entities (The Haverhill Brewery & the Tap Brewpub) we have decided it's in everyone's best interest to consolidate into one, singular brand. That is why as of October 1, 2012 we became The Tap Brewing Company!

The Tap Brewing Company is located inside a nearly 120 year old mill that at one point was the epicenter of Haverhill's massive shoe manufacturing industry. High ceilings, dark grain wood, exposed brick and rich character. We highlight the history of the building without it becoming an intrusive element. Our style is simplistic and straight forward, both in atmosphere and menu. We're right in the middle of a bustling downtown that sits along a beautiful river which our large deck overlooks for an incredible outdoor dining experience in the Summer months. Or heck, a pint during a snowstorm. Our hope is to provide you with a great meal, great beer and outstanding service in a laid-back atmosphere. A mellow, all-encompassing brewpub experience.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Mon-Fri, 8am-4pm

data.name: Eastside
data.description:
Honoring the eclectic East Side of the city, this Bavarian dark lager is a blend of three specialty grains, creating a rich, smooth, dark beer that anyone can enjoy. 

Pours a clear, dark color with a nice off-white head. Hints of roasted malts find their way into the aroma, and form a pleasant background to the dark, rich flavor. The German lager yeast rounds out this brew with a smooth, complex finish. It's art in brewed form!
data.foodPairings: Beef dishes especially go well with this brew  the roasted malt character stands up well to their rich flavor.

Its rich history includes partnerships with local taverns, preservation of local historical pieces, unique tours, family style dining options and most importantly, great beer.

breweries.name: Bayhawk Ales
breweries.description: Bayhawk Ales, Orange County's largest microbrewery, began operation in late 1994 with our first beer being poured in February '95. We are a public corporation with over 1000 local and out of state stockholders. Bayhawk specializes in brewing House Beers for many fine restaurants and taverns throughout California, Arizona, Nevada, Oregon, and Washington. We just might be the Greatest Beer You Never Knew You Drank!

data.name: Excelsior Dark Lager
data.description: A light-bodied dark beer crafted with Perle hops alongside roasted chocolate & caramel malts.  Deliciously drinkable!

breweries.name: Portsmouth Brewing Co
breweries.description: The Portsmouth Brewing Company is Ohio’s oldest operating brewery, built in 1843. The PBC has revived a classic recipe from the 1840′s in Red Bird Ale, a version of the local steam ale. Also kept alive are the fundamental German style lagers brewed here after the civil war in Portsmouth Pilsner and Crystal Gold Lager.

data.description: Translation “end of the world”, this dark lager is inspired by Mayan culture combining maize, cacao and regional spices. We plan on having this on tap till at least December 21st, after that, well who knows…

breweries.name: Franklin's Restaurant, Brewery & General Store
breweries.description: Franklins is located in the heart of historic Hyattsville in a landmark building built in the 1880’s as a blacksmith and carriage shop. Starting in 1910, the building housed the Hyattsville Hardware Co. which stayed in continuous operation until 1992. In its heyday, the hardware Co. was the center of community activity, selling everything from pots and pans to remedies for livestock maladies, chicken feed and of course, nuts and bolts. Many people bought their first washing machines and iceboxes here. Trains from Baltimore stopped right out back and delivered loads of lumber, stacks of seed, even whole houses from the Sears catalog. Neighbors gathered and talked about the weather, the schools, rising prices and changing times

breweries.name: Sherwood Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sherwood Brewing Company opened its doors on August 31, 2006 in the Hayes Center Shoppes plaza on Hayes Rd. north of Hall Rd. (M-59) in Shelby Township, Michigan.

We serve only the finest hand-crafted beer, wine, and sodas, all made in our on-site brewing facility.

Sherwood Brewing Company is proud and honored to be the recipient of WDIV's "4 the Best" award for Best Brewpub for four consecutive years (2007 - 2010) as voted by you, our customers.

data.name: Goatman
data.description:
The third in our limited release Legendary Series, Goatman is a hybrid of beer styles. It's inspired by the hairy and horned, territorial terror that is said to live around White Rock Lake, startling visitors with flying trash and a nasty attitude. 

This dark, unique brew is a melding of a West Coast Black IPA and a German Schwarzbier, encompassing all of the sticky, bitter bite you love, with a smooth, roasted malt body balancing it all out. It's enough to curl your toes – or maybe your hooves.
data.foodPairings: Stanky, pungent cheese, such as Limburger, Southern chicken fried steak, spicy chorizo, crawfish étouffée, or chocolate truffles

breweries.name: Lakewood Brewing Company
breweries.description:
From our origins home brewing out of a garage in the east Dallas neighborhood of Lakewood, to quickly becoming one of the fastest growing craft breweries in North Texas, we stay true to our vision of local beer for local folks. We're dedicated to using the highest quality ingredients to produce internationally inspired and locally crafted beers, perfect for whichever neighborhood you call home.
Pay us a visit in our taproom and beer garden. Brewery tours are offered on the weekends and free to the public. Schol!

breweries.name: Great Crescent Brewery
breweries.description:
The Great Crescent Brewery beers are made with all malt, fresh hops and whole ingredients. Every beer is hand-crafted in small batches using traditional brewing methods. We package our beer in self-pressurizing mini-kegs that hold the equivalent of a case of beer, half–gallon refillable growler bottles and 1/6 barrel (5 gallon) kegs that can be used in commercial and home draft systems. Some of our specialty beers, like our Cherry Ale, will only be available in limited quantities.
We are a production brewery that sells beer right from the premises. Although we don’t currently have a tasting room where we can sell beer by the glass – we will be offering samples to help you decide which beer to purchase.

We are open to the public Wednesday-Friday 2pm to 7pm, Saturday 12 (noon) to 7pm and Sunday 12 (noon) to 4pm. You can purchase our beers outside of the brewery at The Pour House in Aurora, Indiana, Bakers Discount Liquors in Rising Sun, Indiana and Whitey’s in Lawrenceburg, Indiana. We are also available on draft at Bourbons Bar & Grill in Lawrenceburg, Indiana.

locations.name: Main Brewery

Saturday Noon to 6PM
Closed Sunday through Thursday

data.name: guardian 14
data.description:
Beer firmly connected to the venerable glory Rychnovský brewery comes to life again. The 100th anniversary of the beginning of the brewing family Mikšová have we cooked for you again. This is the type of old Czech dark beer, which our ancestors drank in the period after fasting.
It is made from several kinds of caramel, highly aromatic malts, giving the beer intensely black, caramel flavor and aroma. Selected hopping along with the adjustment of the brewing process ensures balanced sweet and bitter taste. Cold leads main fermentation, a long time lying and maturation and higher wort concentration - 14% by weight. It supports full flavor and esterification. Enhances the bouquet characteristic of dark beers. We wish you good appetite and a pleasant time with beer Kvadrian, black pearl among rychnovskými beers.

data.name: Hanukkah, Chanukah
data.description: Chanukah Beer pours a rich crystal clear chestnut to ruby color with a light creamy head. The aroma and flavors lean toward a robust winter warmer, though brewed without any spices. Just all malt and hop goodness! Light caramel and toasty nuttiness as well as a hint of sweeter chocolate are rounded out by a healthy dose of European Noble and classic American new school hops. With 8 malts, 8 hops and 8% alcohol, this beer is real wonder with so many elements blending to create balanced and yet still distinct flavors. Hanukkah Beer is brewed as a celebration offering and sure to light up your holiday season. L’Chaim!

breweries.name: Shmaltz Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Shmaltz Brewing Company is an American craft brewing company that brews He'brew Beer. Shmaltz is known for blurring beer styles and using puns, art, history, and pop culture in every aspect of its products. 

Founded as the first and still only "Jewish-celebration beer," proprietor Jeremy Cowan established the company in San Francisco in 1996 with the first 100 cases of He’brew Beer hand bottled and delivered throughout the Bay Area in his Grandmother’s Volvo. He’brew now sells across 35 states, through 40 wholesalers and nearly 5,000 retailers. 

After 17 years of being an outspoken cheerleader for contract brewing, Shmaltz recently broke with tradition and opened its own New York State production brewery in Clifton Park, NY, 10 minutes north of Albany’s capital district. Shmaltz’s new home boasts a 50-barrel brewhouse with 30,000 barrels of annual capacity. The new brewery packages 12 and 22 ounce bottles and kegs of their diverse core and seasonal favorites, and hosts fans and beer tourists in their new tasting room for tours, barrel-aged previews, and special releases.

data.name: Harmonie Dark Lager
data.description:
This beer is based on the very first comercially brewed beer in the state of Indiana.

The name of the brewer was George Bentel. His house is still standing in New Harmony.  The Harmonist brewer and cooper, George Bentel, was born November 3, 1781 in Iptingen, the same village in the Swabian kingdom of Württemberg where George Rapp was born.  Bentel lived at the northeast corner of Brewery and Grainery streets, where his house remains today, as upright as when Indiana's first brewer marched out to make his beer almost two centuries ago.
The German utopian communalists in New Harmony were Indiana's first significant brewers. Beginning in 1816, the Harmonists eventually brewed enough to sell all the way up to what is now West Virginia and down into lower Illinois. From the historical record, it appears the Harmonists brewed a porter-like dark beer. It must have been pretty good beer: An educated German, Ferdinand Ernst, stopped in New Harmony during his journey through the frontier region. “They served me a stein of beer,” Ernst wrote, “and I was not a little astonished to find here a genuine, real Bamberg beer.” He gushed that the Harmonists “must be happiest people of entire Christiandom.” A Louisville agent for the Harmonists reported, “Mr. Breeden, the most celebrated porter seller in the place says the strongest part of it would almost pass for porter and is the best beer he has ever seen in this country…

breweries.description: Heineken Lager Beer was first brewed by Gerard Adriaan Heineken in 1873. The beer is made of purified water, malted barley, hops, and yeast. In 1886 H. Elion finished the development of the Heineken A-yeast, which is still used in the brewing process today

data.name: Hermann's Dark Lager
data.description: A proud and passionate Bavarian, Hermann was one of our original Brewmasters. He handcrafted this traditional German recipe to satisfy his longing for a local beer that reflected the true taste of his homeland. Consistently recognized as one of the world’s best dark lagers, this refreshing beer has a toasty malt body, yet is very smooth and finishes clean. We hope you enjoy our authentic Bavarian Dark Lager. Prost!

data.name: Hoppy Cat
data.description: A brown, coffee colored Dark Ipa with toasted malts and a peculiar North American hop. You can smell an intriguing blend of toasted and citrus notes given by the hop, which we use since the mashing. When you taste it, you’ll be amazed! Its intense hoppy and resinous notes – given by this particular hop – merge with the vibrant roasted overtones. You will be surprised by its drinkability, thanks to its smoothness and to a moderate ABV (5,8 %) together with a marked bitterness (55 IBU).

style.name: American-Style Dark Lager
style.description: This beer's malt aroma and flavor are low but notable. Its color ranges from a very deep copper to a deep, dark brown. It has a clean, light body with discreet contributions from caramel and roasted malts. Non-malt adjuncts are often used, and hop rates are low. Hop bitterness is clean and has a short duration of impact. Hop flavor, and aroma are low. Carbonation is high. Fruity esters, diacetyl, and chill haze should not be perceived.

data.name: Insulated Lager
data.description: Brooklyn Insulated Lager is your protection against biting wind and soggy weather. German Munich, roasted Carafa, and Pilsner malts create a nimble, racy body, while a helping of American black barley adds just a hint of roast coffee. A light dry hopping of American and German hops pitter-patters across the nose and dives into the dry, warming finish.
data.foodPairings: Dark breads, hearty meats, game, wild fowl, barbecue, and sturdy cheddars.

breweries.name: Brooklyn Brewery
breweries.description: Since its founding in 1988, The Brooklyn Brewery brews flavorful beers that enrich the life, tradition and culture of the communities it serves. Its award-winning roster of year round, season and specialty products have gained the Brewery notoriety as one of the top craft beer producers in the world. Brooklyn beers are currently distributed in 25 states and 17 countries, and throughout 2011 the brewery underwent an expansion that will double overall capacity by 2013. In addition to facilitating community meetings at its event space, brewery employees serve on not-for-profit boards, including the Prospect Park Alliance, the Open Space Alliance, Transportation Alternatives and the Brooklyn Historical Society. Each year the company supports many charitable and arts organizations including BAM, Brooklyn Museum and MoMA, and partners with food purveyors across the country to produce beer dinners and tasting events. The Brewery is open to the public Monday-Thursday from 5-7pm for reservation-only Small Batch tours, Friday evening for Happy Hour, and Saturdays and Sundays for Tours and Tastings. For more info, visit BrooklynBrewery.com and follow @BrooklynBrewery on Twitter.

data.name: John Michael Dark Lyric Lagrrr!
data.description: Deliciously Evil. With its deep dark hue, an abundant hop presence and surprising smooth quaffability this beer in black is what we mean when we say "Lagrrr!" (usually followed by an echoing, sinister laughter).

data.name: Kern
data.description:
Origin of name: the name of the beer comes for the mutual cooperation between the brewery and the rock group Kern.

Taste: Kern combines the classic bitterness of light beers with the sweeter caramel taste of dark beers. These characteristics are not obtained by mixing ready made beer. It obtains its taste by mixing various types of malt during the brewing process. Kern has a reddish to granite color and a pleasant hops to slightly caramel fragrance. It is produced in the attempt to satisfy every beer consumer who likes to combine light and dark beers.

With a passion for craft beer, they set out to pay homage to the beautiful Santa Ynez Valley with handcrafted beer and hand-drawn artwork depicting the local landscape on their labels.  There are currently five taprooms along California’s Central Coast and one taproom set to open in Westlake Village late summer 2015.  Figueroa Mountain Brewing Co. beer can be found in their taprooms or at select retailers and restaurants throughout California.  Learn more about @FigMtnBrew or where to find their beer at www.FigMtnBrew.com.

data.name: Lobo Negro
data.description: Dark lager beer existed decades before the dawn of the light Pilsner lager beer.  Mainly due to the malting & drying practices of the day, the lack of technology denied the Brewers of malt that was both light in color and dry enough to store properly.  LOBO Negro is a true “Dunkel” or dark brown lager with a spicy maltiness that is neither sweet nor too roastily dry.  Our Lager yeast, working at low temperatures, imparts a clean roundness and balance to this world class beauty.

breweries.name: Pedernales Brewing Company
breweries.description: Pedernales Brewing Company is proud to announce their highly anticipated opening in the city of Fredericksburg, Texas. Texas Hill Country's newest microbrewery will feature Classic and German-style beers. PBC’s impressive lineup of beers will include skillfully crafted lagers and ales. At this time we are offering our flagship brands; LOBO and LOBO Negro. “LOBO” is the name of the WOLF native to Texas and the Southwest.  Sadly, the wolf was almost wiped out by big ranchers some 100 years ago; not unlike the small craft brewers who were similarly annihilated by prohibition.

breweries.name: Yukon Brewing
breweries.description:
Yukon Brewing opened its doors in 1997 under the name Chilkoot Brewing Co. Ltd. Owners Alan and Bob conceived their idea like many Yukon babies – around a campfire on a canoe trip. Both Ontario natives, they’ve lived and worked in the Territory for a good deal of their adult lives.

From that inaugural conversation grew plans for a craft brewery that would service the north with quality beer while keeping jobs and money in the territory.

Over a decade later Yukon Brewing, as it is called today, continues to work towards that goal. Employing a dozen or so staff (more in the busy summer months), Yukon Brewing actively supports countless Yukon events and causes each year.

Bob and Alan continue as owners and chief operators, growing the company outside the Yukon. The breweries 8 packaged beers are available across Alberta and BC with some even finding their way as far east as Quebec and at the Hannover Zoo in Germany.

data.name: Lovely Saint Winefride
data.description:
Lovely Saint Winefride is a brown lager, brewed by Dann using a decoction mash. The beer is malty, containing a blend of German and English malts, and it’s clean as you’d expect from a lager. The beer was lagered over deepest winter for 8 weeks and will be available in kegs and 22oz bottles in MA, with bits and pieces going elsewhere in the USA.

St Winefride lived in post-Roman Wales from 600 to 660 A.D. She was charming and intelligent, and decided to become a nun. Unfortunately, this news went down poorly with her suitor, Caradoc, who hacked off her head. Luckily, her Uncle Beuno was able to perform the miracle of reattaching it and she recovered fully. (Hooray!). She became an Abbess and governed Gwytherin Abbey in Wales until her death on November 3rd, 660 A.D.

The lager, yes lager, started out as an idea to create a very rustic beer with a roasted character and a brown disposition. We imagined a pre-Great War sort of beer that might have been on its last legs of popularity. The kind of beer young folks of the time would laugh about as being “an old man’s lagerbier”. Well Pretty Things is the old-man’s-dream-beer-brewer, so we decided to give it a whirl. We started with malted barley and hops from the German tradition and employed a single decoction mash. Decoction is a slightly complicated, time intensive and little used technique (on this continent anyway) that insured temperature accuracy in the age before real temperature control. Got it? Okay, that was a boring explanation. How is this: we took a portion of the mash and boiled it at 212 degrees F for 15 minutes. Trust us, boiling a mash is rare. Dann has only done this once in his twenty year career (on purpose anyway). Ahem. We continue by saying this brown lager is also quite delicious and nice to drink. If you choose to not think about boiling mashes and old men we assure you this beer will still very much please your palate.

Tasting notes: deep brown red colour, tannish head, fine carbonation, deep dark malt character with quite a lot of yeast presence in the flavour, refined Hallertau hoppiness. 7% ABV

Quite a lady! We hope you enjoy this beer! Keep an eye on this page as we will add more beery-details in the days to come.

breweries.name: Pretty Things Beer & Ale Project
breweries.description:
We are a gypsy brewery, without a permanent brewing home. We like it that way, we can be whatever we want to be on a shoestring budget. What more do you want than that?

Our flagship beer is Jack D'Or. Jack is the mournful grain of barley you can see to the right. He is the soul of beer, nature's magician, creating sugar from starch and bringing together the Pretty Things to produce the substance we adore: beer.

data.name: Lumberjack
data.description: Picture this: A giant of a man with a formidable beard enters the local tavern and rests his axe on the bar top. Does he order a watered down beer or something as big and bold as the life he lives? Lumberjack Black Lager is just such a beer. With its toasty flavors and clean, refreshing finish, it is bound to make a man out of any beer drinker, and a fan out of the manliest!

breweries.name: Palmetto Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Opened by Ed Falkenstein and Louis Bruce in 1993 to create a locally-brewed alternative to domestic and import beers, Palmetto is South Carolina's oldest brewery and the first to open in the state since Prohibition. We make four year-round styles of beer, with every batch brewed in our twenty-five barrel brewing system.

Ed and Louis started making great beers after a windsurfing trip to Hood River Oregon. After finding inspiration and realizing that Charleston needed some better beer, they set up shop on Huger Street and have been brewing up trouble ever since. 

Wanna come see us?

Tasting Room hours are:
Tues-Thurs 3pm - 9pm
Fri-Sat 1pm - 10pm

data.name: Moa Noir
data.description: Moa Noir is a traditionally brewed European style dark lager with an abundance of distinct aromas and flavours. Chocolate and richly roasted coffee beans dominate the senses with a full flavoured palate, giving Moa Noir a long smooth finish. A perfect beer for the changing of seasons.

breweries.name: Moa Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Moa beer is the beer that comes from Marlborough, which is nice, because mostly Marlborough just makes wine, which is a bit boring. Moa uses the same deep bore water locals use to grow grapes and put out house fires.

Moa Beer is also made the way beer used to be made before everyone started making it differently.

So if somehow someone from 1950 travelled in time to go to the pub and had a Moa today they wouldn’t be surprised by its full bodied taste. This is because Moa beer is made by lots of people and not many machines as opposed to lots of machines and not many people. They would however, be surprised by the cost as Moa is quite expensive and they’d be used to only paying two and six. Whatever that is.

data.name: Monkey Stones
data.description: Monkey Stones is a collaboration between Monkey Paw and brewer Jeremy Moynier from Stone Brewing Company. After some discussion, we decided to make a black lager, with a bit of Stone flair. This is a strong, 7.7%, black, toasty beer with attitude. Roast, toasted almonds, and a pine-filled hop aroma are first on the nose. As the beer warms up, you notice a lot of chocolate and orange, with a solid hop bite. The taste is similar, but smooth, hoppy, and delicious. This is not your typical black lager. Do you have the stones to drink it?

breweries.name: Stone Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Founded by Greg Koch and Steve Wagner in 1996, San Diego-based Stone Brewing Co. is the 10th largest craft brewer in the United States. Stone has been listed on the Inc. 500 | 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies list nine times, and has been called the “All-time Top Brewery on Planet Earth” by BeerAdvocate magazine twice. The multi-faceted company will be the first American craft brewer to independently own and operate facilities in Berlin, Germany and also has plans to open operations east of the Mississippi. Known for its bold, flavorful and largely hop-centric beers, Stone has earned a reputation for brewing outstanding, unique beers while maintaining an unwavering commitment to sustainability, business ethics, philanthropy and the art of brewing.

data.name: Oakie Doakie
data.description: Deeply malty, with caramel apparent. Smoky secondary aromas are also present, adding complexity.  Hops are quite low. Dark brown color, with deep ruby highlights. Clear with a large tan head. Richly malt with kettle caramelization. Hints of roasted malt and smoky flavor are present. Hop flavors and bitterness are medium-low, so malt impression dominates. Full-bodied, having a thick, chewy viscosity. A smooth, alcoholic warmth is present and is quite welcome since it balances the malty sweetness. Moderate carbonation. 8.1% ABV.

breweries.name: D.L. Geary Brewing Company
breweries.description: The D.L. Geary Brewing Company was incorporated in October, 1983 by David and Karen Geary who shared the vision of producing world class products on a small scale for local and regional consumption. At that time, there were only 13 so-called microbreweries in the United States, almost all of them in California and the Pacific Northwest. In the winter of 1984, David Geary began a period of training and research in Scotland and England. With the help of Peter Maxwell Stuart, a Scottish nobleman and brewer who arranged introductions and itineraries, he worked in a half-dozen small commercial breweries from the highlands of Scotland to the south coast of England.

We brew authentic craft beer in our brewhouse with a traditional German style brewing system and pour fresh brews daily from 16 taps in the pub area. Our menu specializes in oak wood -fired smoked dishes and local fare. We offer children their own special menu too!  Basecamp is open daily: 11:30pm serving lunch & dinner.

breweries.name: Oliphant Brewing
breweries.description:
we're pretty sure that the beer made was part ectoplasmic mud intended as a 5th dimensional chrysalis for an almost immediate and rude awakening of shrimp-kind. once fed to the prawny bastards they grow strong and stout. they're tenuous ligament connections calcify and grow stronger and they can appear to read people's minds by a simple flexing of their delicious muscles. they're tv antenna antennas probe the air and gently wave in the breeze though the touch them is as touching rough-grit sand and glass paper and leaves tiny shards similar grabbing the white paint of a fire hydrant marker. 

we had no idea. we swear. 

we're just here's to brew beer, not help with the awakening of the earth's 6th cycle of developed beings. that being said -- all hail the prawn people! may their mighty and lesser claws be bound only by their own strength of will. let the buddha shrimp click and clackle their obscene language to the world.

style.description: This beer's malt aroma and flavor are low but notable. Its color ranges from a very deep copper to a deep, dark brown. It has a clean, light body with discreet contributions from caramel and roasted malts. Non-malt adjuncts are often used, and hop rates are low. Hop bitterness is clean and has a short duration of impact. Hop flavor, and aroma are low. Carbonation is high. Fruity esters, diacetyl, and chill haze should not be perceived.

data.name: Pernštejn Semi-dark beer
data.description: The basic ingredients for the semi-dark beer are special malts. These malts are designed to produce dark beers but they are mixed with light malt. It results in taste, smell and colour at the interface between light and dark beer. Medium-deep fermentation ensures the desire alcohol content and a pleasant feeling after drinking. Selected ingredients ensure this beer has a pleasant hoppy bitternes and aroma. Strong bite and higher foaming are standard indicators for this type of beer.

data.name: Praha
data.description: A range of specialty bohemian malts impart caramel and roasted flavors. Healthy additions of Czech Saaz hops throughout the boil adds a spicy earthiness. An old world three month lager period creates a clean crisp finish. This beer is inspired by the dark lager brewed at Prague’s U Fleků, the worlds oldest brewpub. 5.1% ABV 22 IBUs

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

breweries.name: Exile Brewing Company
breweries.description: Inspired by the countless immigrants who have made our country what it is today, Exile Brewing Co. is a hand-crafted brewery fueled by the passion of a burn-bright lifestyle, and driven by a unique sense of gratitude for the customer, community and future of our land.

data.name: Prokop 12 ° dark

Beer dark black color with an average alcohol content of 4.2% vol.
Distinctive flavor of dark lager adds roasted malt and aromatic Saaz hops.

data.name: Quickhatch
data.description: Brown lager, fermented and aged in "third-use" bourbon barrels. Look for refined notes of bourbon, a subtly sweet malt character, and an inkling of oak barrel.

breweries.name: Wolverine State Brewing Company
breweries.description: We are the proud brewers of Michigan's Most Drinkable Beers. We are the only microbrewery in Michigan that specializes in making lagers for everyone. What does this mean? It means that from light to dark, every beer we brew is designed to be a beer you can love.

breweries.name: Rapp Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Welcome to Rapp Brewing Company!
Home of hand crafted small batch artisanal Ales and Lagers.
Our goal is to bring you the finest examples of traditional beer styles using the best available ingredients.
We also offer you intriguing variations of traditional styles as well as exploring styles from past ages.
We use our creativity in the art of brewing and invite you to join us in that adventure.

breweries.name: Home of the Brave Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Since 1991 Hawaii's Home of the Brave has proudly supported and honored our United States military. Join our continued mission to serve our troops by opening Hawaii's first Brewseum. We want to provide our troops and all Americans with the finest locally crafted beer. With your support, together we can make it a reality. Support America - Support Our Troops - Buy Home of the Brave.

locations.name: The Brewseum
locations.hoursOfOperation: The Brewseum is a brewpub celebrating the history of beer in Hawaii. Enjoy some of the best beers in Honolulu at an incredible one-of-a-kind spot!
